poem:
Title: "Czech Mails of Risk and Reward"

Křetínský, life's billionaire,
teases Royal Mail with potential despair.
An offer cast, a future's cast,
a company in shadows vast.
Ofcom bells chime, a warning sent,
annual targets, promises unbent.
IDS, your operation stuttered,
In lines of print, the news is buttered.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Royal Mail owner warns offer from Czech billionaire could put firm at risk Royal Mail’s owner has warned that a potential £3.5bn bid by the Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský could put the company’s financial future and operations at risk. It came as the industry regulator Ofcom announced it had opened an investigation into the parent group, International Distributions Services (IDS), for failing to meet its annual delivery targets for the second year in a row.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Royal Mail owner warns offer from Czech billionaire could put firm at risk Royal Mail’s owner has warned that a potential £3.5bn bid by the Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský could put the company’s financial future and operations at risk. It came as the industry regulator Ofcom announced it had opened an investigation into the parent group, International Distributions Services (IDS), for failing to meet its annual delivery targets for the second year in a row.
